summary: This is an email chain between US Attorney's Office personnel and defense counsel regarding technical issues with discovery in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. Defense attorney Christian Everdell details problems with unreadable files and proposes solutions including sending new hard drives with shortened file paths and encryption.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP representing Ghislaine Maxwell, sending a letter detailing discovery problems and arranging for new hard drives to be delivered to the MDC for Maxwell.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Attorney at Cohen & Gresser LLP, copied on the email regarding discovery issues in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Attorney at Cohen & Gresser LLP, copied on the email regarding discovery issues in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Assistant US Attorney, recipient of the initial call and email regarding discovery problems in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the case, incarcerated at MDC, for whom the discovery materials are being prepared and delivered.

connections.description: Everdell is communicating with prosecutors to resolve discovery access issues for his client, Maxwell, who is incarcerated.
Both are attorneys at Cohen & Gresser LLP working on the Maxwell defense, copied on the same email.
Both are attorneys at Cohen & Gresser LLP working on the Maxwell defense, copied on the same email.
Everdell (defense) is corresponding with Pagliuca (prosecution) to resolve technical discovery issues.

events.title: Discovery Access Issues Raised
events.description: Defense counsel Christian Everdell sends a letter and email detailing that Ghislaine Maxwell cannot open certain discovery files at the MDC and arranges to ship new hard drives with corrected files.

locations: New York, NY 10077 (Cohen & Gresser LLP office address)
keyFacts: Defense attorneys reported significant technical problems with discovery materials provided to Ghislaine Maxwell at the MDC, including unreadable files and file path issues.
The defense arranged to ship two new hard drives to prosecutors—one with on-board encryption and one without—to reload the entire discovery production with shortened file paths.
The defense specifically requested replacement copies of documents in the 'LSJ' subfolder of the 'Search warrant photos' folder due to viewing problems.
This communication shows the logistical challenges of providing digital discovery to an incarcerated defendant in a high-profile case.
The email highlights the ongoing pretrial preparation and evidence review in the Ghislaine Maxwell case as of August 2020.
